section: This Website Design, Development and Hosting Agreement the ("Agreement") is entered into on January 11, 2018 by and between Natalija Tunevic, director of FreeCook (hereinafter referred to as "Client") and Mitchell Vitalis, director of Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC (hereinafter referred to as "Service Provider").
explanation: The document defines Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC as the 'Service Provider.' However, in subsequent sections (1(a), 4), Mitchell's Web Advance, PLC is referred to as 'Company.' This inconsistency in terminology can lead to confusion regarding the entity providing the services.

section: Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A.
explanation: Section 2 states that the 'Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work.' Section 2 says a total of $5,000 will be paid. However, section 1 says that $5,000 is the sum to design and develop a website. This creates an inconsistency in text that should be reviewed.

section: Client agrees to pay to Company the sum of $5,000 (the "Contract Price") to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (b) Due Dates and Delays. Company will use its best efforts to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018.
explanation: The agreement is entered into on January 11, 2018, but the 'Terms of the Project' are said to be '12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018.' This is 16 weeks, not 12. This creates an inconsistency in dates.
